name: What is a Woman?
description: Daily three-hour sessions watching political commentator Matt Walsh's documentary, 'What is a Woman?'. Study topics include people portrayed in the documentary, dialogue in various scenes, and the innotations of Walsh's voice.'

name: Starbucks Training
description: A study of duties and work environments in Starbucks sites worldwide. Study topics include preparing food, interacting with customers, and lethal self-defense.

name: History of Gender Studies
description: A study of the field of gender studies across history. Special attention will be given to trends like the LGBTQ movement and the Salem witch trials.

name: Internet Meme History
description: A study of memes through the history of the Internet. Special attention will be given to the gender-related undertones of memes and how memes can be weaponized for political gain

name: Gender Reveal Parties
description: A course exploring gender reveal parties

name: Evils of Generation Z
description: A course on the evil nature of Generation Z-ers. Readings and class discussions will explore Gen Z's impact on anti-feminism, occultic Gen Z rituals, and students' personal hatred toward people in Gen Z

name: Dating and Marriage
description: A course on dating with a major focus on hands-on experience. By the end of the course, students will be married.

name: Divorce
description: A course on divorce with a major focus on hands-on experience. Students will file divorce papers in court.

name: Gender Biology
description: A study into the biology behind the human genders

name: Learning to Love Again
description: A course on recovering from a broken relationship. By the end of this course, students will have recovered from their losses, found new suitable partners, and remarried.

name: Gender Psychology
description: A study into the psychological distinctions of the human genders

name: Dr. Rouse
description: A study into Dr. Rouse, the ultimate embodiment of the male gender.

name: Psychological Warfare
description: The capstone class for gender studies. An in-depth study into using the knowledge in previous classes for domination and suppression of political enemies. Topics will include blackmail, deception, girlbossing, operating military weapons, raising children, and persuading Dr. Rouse to do one's bidding. The course will end with a forceful takeover of LeTourneau and Longview.
